content.rendered:
Photo by Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, 2.3 lands, new Genesis contributors and a small but handy new plugin from Bill Erickson.

Genesis 2.3 (and new contributors!)

Yup, it’s the latest and greatest release of the Genesis Framework, version 2.3.

Genesis 2.3 now available. Update now with one-click! https://t.co/SSARqViVzc #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/WqEreEevuo

— StudioPress (@studiopress) June 15, 2016

Named Nick in honour of my greatness (OK, I made that up), Genesis 2.3 focuses on a “backlog of bug reports and enhancement suggestions” rather than big new features but, nevertheless, it’s a very welcome release.

And it seems to be going down well…

Well, first @WooCommerce update, then #GenesisWP update. Site still running smooth as silk even with 50 active plugins 🙂

— BobWP (@bobWP) June 16, 2016

@studiopress thanks for the update to #genesiswp, now at 2.3.0. Appreciate your continuing focus on this great WordPress theme!

— Neville Hobson (@jangles) June 16, 2016

Looks like I picked a good time to run client updates. Shiny new #Genesis 2.3 just became available #genesiswp

— Digital Davidson (@digidavidson) June 15, 2016

The only slight confusion seems to be the removal of the CSS column classes from the framework itself (a good thing). From this thread in the Facebook group, it looks like a few people were pulling these classes in ‘incorrectly’ from the Genesis Framework directly (instead of putting them in a child theme).

If you or a client is affected by that though, there’s a simple to handle this. Simply add the CSS classes at the following link (thanks to Anita for sharing the link in the Facebook group) to your child theme.

As ever huge thanks to all the contributors for their time and efforts, especially to new contributors Robin Cornett, Mike Hemberger and Calvin Koepke (and apologies if I missed anyone).

Totally stoked to be a core contributor to #genesiswp. I hope to make more contributions with these fine people: pic.twitter.com/u6nVl1fIcb

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) June 16, 2016

Not a major achievement, but still feels pretty cool. Finally an ‘official’ #genesiswp core contributor. Woot! pic.twitter.com/wK8YXnGC84

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) June 16, 2016

.@robincornett I just saw you in the #GenesisWP contributor list when I updated. Congrats!!

— Marcy Diaz (@mjsdiaz1) June 16, 2016

Themes

Theme tease from Brian Gardner.

Here’s a little teaser on the design I’m working on — https://t.co/YK8ZXnpDd3 #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) June 13, 2016

And a definite tease from Calvin Koepke.

I seriously loved this design. Maybe I'll make it for download… https://t.co/0QMrj1ZkpV #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/pxQiWYiWRV

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) June 10, 2016

Showcase

Nicola Tweed with a nice, bright site for kayiya.com

A bright & fun web launch for a FriYay! https://t.co/aL9cUU0Iy1 @hazykays @ashleyknightco #genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/r5YzVjpGGD

— Nicola Tweed (@nicolatweed) June 17, 2016

Tonya launches a new blog, hellofromtonya.com/blog

Ok geeks, my new site https://t.co/ZRtvpRe9wW is a static landing page but the blog https://t.co/idfGYMPqjc is a custom #genesiswp theme

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) June 16, 2016

…plus she’s shared all the code on GitHub.

2/2 and you can get the code for my blog's #genesiswp child theme right here https://t.co/wtNlG0nyha

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) June 16, 2016

New from Patricia Alix Villa, bridalfusionbymascia.com.au…

A fresh start to the week with a new #webdesign launch! #genesiswp #wordpress https://t.co/H1o4lrcYWa pic.twitter.com/Gr9JPlOWyH

— Patricia Alix Villa (@PatFancyGirl) June 13, 2016

…and bethanywalterphotography.com

So thrilled to launch the newly revamped https://t.co/p6f8BUtBSm! Do check it out! #genesiswp #wordpress #webdesign pic.twitter.com/k2zjDaYts3

— Patricia Alix Villa (@PatFancyGirl) June 16, 2016

Ed Harris for tomorrows-harvest.com

Finished work on a rebuild of my website recently. Proud to build with #WordPress and #genesiswp https://t.co/ZjwSHcMaPS

— Ed Harris (@EdHarrisDotMe) June 10, 2016

Podcasts

Carrie Dils chats to Chris Ford on how you can use better project management in your projects without breaking a sweat on the latest episode of OfficeHours.fm

Awesome project management tips with @ci_chrisford on @officehoursfm https://t.co/KescdIQTwy #wordpress

— SiteLock (@SiteLock) June 16, 2016

Plugins

New Genesis Default Archive plugin from Bill Erickson…

Handy new Genesis Default Archive Intro plugin from @BillErickson https://t.co/oS0zr7w2JF

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) June 10, 2016

…just a few hours after the original suggestion from Mike Hemberger (I think it was 🙂 )

"Here's a quick plugin I wrote that adds this functionality.” Because that’s how @BillErickson rolls. #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) June 10, 2016

Best of the rest

Scott shares the best three social sharing plugins for Genesis users.

Social Sharing Of Your Content & Social Proof

Sridhar on:

  • How to wrap entry titles inside a custom div in Genesis,
  • How to display a headline and subheading the page header of Showcase Pro, and
  • How to add font resizer buttons in Genesis.

How to wrap entry titles inside a custom div in Genesis:https://t.co/dVzUPywH5o#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) June 14, 2016

How to display Headline and Subheading in Page Header of Showcase Pro: https://t.co/Cuom44wH8Z pic.twitter.com/YKBplvMEYr

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) June 17, 2016

How to add Font Resizer buttons in Genesis:https://t.co/QJIWbZdY6I pic.twitter.com/RkSxKc8nuH

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) June 17, 2016

Susan reveals that there’s now almost 5,000 members in the GenesisWP Facebook group.

Our Facebook group has almost 5,000 members: https://t.co/20uFgmY1cy join us if you're a developer or designer using #GenesisWP #WordPress

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) June 11, 2016

If you’re a Utility Pro customer you might find this tutorial on changing up the mobile footer menu in Utility Pro by Ginger Coolidge useful.

Change up the mobile footer menu in Utility Pro: https://t.co/B3Y8NqVR3F #genesiswp

— Ginger Coolidge (@gscoolidge) June 16, 2016

And finally…

Sending big love to Tonya.

My first life lessons blog post: How to Cope. Don't Feed the Monsters https://t.co/m1KlCa0tRT #BeHappy

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) June 16, 2016

—

That’s all for this week.

Next week (and the week after) though things are about to get a whole lot more exciting, with guest editors Helena Denley and Susan Ramsey taking over.

So make sure you stick around for that – and if you don’t already – subscribe up (points below) so you don’t miss out.

Most importantly though, have a great weekend. You deserve it.

excerpt.rendered: Version 2.3 of the Genesis Framework lands, new Genesis contributors and a small but handy new plugin from Bill Erickson.
